title: Kyrgios inching closer to Brisbane return
description: Nick Kyrgios is preparing for the Brisbane International presented by Evie, where he will compete in his first tournament in more than 18 months. The ATP 250 event shared footage on social media of the 29-year-old practising in Brisbane Thursday. [ATP APP] Kyrgios reached the Wimbledon final in 2022 and played just one match the following year due to injury. Making his third Brisbane appearance, the home favourite lifted the trophy in 2018. Kyrgios is a seven-time tour-level champion who has been as high as No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings. The Brisbane International presented by Evie runs from 29 December - 5 January. [NEWSLETTER FORM]
excerpt: Nick Kyrgios is preparing for the Brisbane International presented by Evie, where he will compete in his first tournament in more than 18 months.
text: Darrian Traynor/Getty Images Nick Kyrgios, pictured at Melbourne Park in 2023, has not competed on the ATP Tour since June 2023. By ATP Staff The ATP 250 event shared footage on social media of the 29-year-old practising in Brisbane Thursday. Kyrgios reached the Wimbledon final in 2022 and played just one match the following year due to injury. Making his third Brisbane appearance, the home favourite lifted the trophy in 2018. Kyrgios is a seven-time tour-level champion who has been as high as No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings.
html:
Darrian Traynor/Getty Images

Nick Kyrgios, pictured at Melbourne Park in 2023, has not competed on the ATP Tour since June 2023. By ATP Staff

The ATP 250 event shared footage on social media of the 29-year-old practising in Brisbane Thursday.

Kyrgios reached the Wimbledon final in 2022 and played just one match the following year due to injury.

Making his third Brisbane appearance, the home favourite lifted the trophy in 2018. Kyrgios is a seven-time tour-level champion who has been as high as No. 13 in the PIF ATP Rankings.
